REGIONAL SCHEDULE MANAGER

SUMMARY

Mr.
Ginder has been working in the heavy civil construction industry for nearly 20 years.
He has been working primarily as a Primavera scheduler since 2006.
The range of the projects vary between less than $5 million railroad projects to over $1.3 billion light rail projects.
The type of projects range from railroads, mass transit light rail systems, interstate highway projects, and marine bridge projects.
Highlights
Primavera 6 up to version 8.2 Tilos Linear Schedule Sure Track MS Project Excel / Word / Powerpoint Estimating Software - HCSS Certified Professional Engineer
Enterprise One JD Edwards Cost Software Resource and Cost Loaded Schedules Primavera Contract Manager / Expedition AutoCAD version 13 Training in Advanced Project Management in Primavera P6

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Prepared a proposal schedule for a design build project with MnDOT that was key for Ames successful proposal.
Instrumental in developing the schedules for various design phases and work packages for the first Contract Manager General Contractor (CMGC) project with MnDOT.
Prepared numerous schedules with cost loaded resource data to support the Full Funding Grant Agreement for a $1.3 billion light rail project.

:

Colorado School of Mines
Civil Engineering

Paul, and the Winona Bridge CMGC project in Winona, MN.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Stormwater Construction Field Manager

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Project Management, Science

Description:
Position: Stormwater Construction Field ManagerIndustry: Stormwater ConstructionLocation: Remote
Are you highly motivated, hard-working, and seeking to join a growth-focused construction, environmental consulting & engineering firm? Are you looking for a company that will invest in your development and grow your professional skills? If so, consider a career with Apex.Apex Companies is a growth-focused environmental & utility construction firm offering services in stormwater system construction and maintenance. We take pride in keeping our clients happy and have earned numerous awards for project excellence. We continue to grow, and we want you to grow with us.We are accepting applicants for a Field Manager. The ideal candidate must have 3-6 years of experience of increasing responsibility, knowledge in stormwater construction management or wet utility construction management. Candidate should possess proficiency in construction processes, comprehension of managing timelines and budgets, alongside communication skills at an advanced level.
Your Responsibilities as a Construction Field Manager:· Perform scope of work reviews with construction crews on approved stormwater construction projects.· Oversee, mentor, and manage several small construction crews.· Schedule crews, materials, vendors, and equipment for the execution of stormwater construction projects.· Maintain open and effective communication with the Regional Construction Manager.· Ensure work quality, project timelines, performance, and budgets meet expectation.· Ensure the project tracking programs are regularly updated in real time.· Assist in reviewing work completion reports.· Actively develop your own career growth.
Why you'll love working for us:· Company-subsidized medical and dental.· Company-paid life, short, and long-term disability.· 401k match, tuition assistance, and more.· Cross-training and the ability to work on a variety of projects.· Working with the best and brightest in the industry.· 1,000+ employee national firm with 50+ locations across the US.
What we're looking for:· 3 to 6 years' experience in stormwater construction or related fields.· Valid driver's license, good driving history, and reliable transportation are required.· Experience with Deltek Vantage Point is highly desired.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
